questions.question: Standard port number for HTTPS connections.
questions.explanation: Port 443 is the default for encrypted HTTPS traffic.

questions.question: Protocol that maps IP addresses to MAC addresses.
questions.explanation: ARP resolves network layer addresses to link layer addresses.

questions.question: Subnet mask for a Class C network.
questions.explanation: Class C networks use this default subnet mask.

questions.question: Internet protocol that provides connectionless datagram service.
questions.explanation: UDP is faster than TCP but doesn't guarantee delivery.

questions.question: Loopback IP address for testing network software.
questions.explanation: 127.0.0.1 routes back to the local computer.

questions.question: Protocol used to automatically assign IP addresses.
questions.explanation: DHCP dynamically assigns IP addresses to devices.

questions.question: Standard protocol for synchronizing computer clocks over a network.
questions.explanation: NTP synchronizes time across network devices.

questions.question: Protocol for securely accessing remote computers.
questions.explanation: SSH provides encrypted remote login and command execution.

questions.question: Technology that translates private IP addresses to public ones.
questions.explanation: NAT allows multiple devices to share a single public IP.

questions.question: Next generation Internet Protocol addressing system.
questions.explanation: IPv6 uses 128-bit addresses to replace IPv4.
